Tactus-examples LLM Guidance (Canonical)

This repository contains runnable examples of the Tactus DSL.
This file is intended for AI assistants and automated tooling so they can:
- understand the canonical syntax patterns used here
- avoid hallucinating obsolete APIs

Primary canonical references live in the main Tactus repo:
- llms.txt
- docs/model-primitive.md
- docs/agent-primitive.md
- docs/model-training-walkthrough.md

================================================================================
MODEL PRIMITIVE
================================================================================

Models are stateless inference interfaces (classification/extraction/scoring).

Canonical runtime call pattern:

  local m = Model("imdb_nb")
  local result = m({text = input.text})
  local out = result.output or result

Trainable models keep training config inside the Model block:

  Model "imdb_nb" { ..., training = { data = {...}, candidates = {...} } }

CLI:
- Train:    tactus train file.tac --model imdb_nb
- Evaluate: tactus models evaluate file.tac --model imdb_nb

Testing:
- CI-safe: use `Mocks { ... }` + `tactus test file.tac --mock`
- Real: train then run `tactus test file.tac` (loads from registry)

================================================================================
AGENT PRIMITIVE
================================================================================

Agents are stateful multi-turn runtimes (LLM + tools).

In CI, mock agents with `Mocks { agent_name = { tool_calls = [...], message = ... } }`.
